case_title: LIAQAT ALI vs ARSHAD MAHMOOD LODHI, ADVOCATE

accussed_details.name: Arshad Mehmood Lodhi
allegation: Gross negligence in performance of duties

complaint_summary: Liaqat Ali alleged that Arshad Mehmood Lodhi, Advocate, failed to file complaints despite receiving Rs.10,300 as professional fees, returning only Rs.5,000 and withholding Rs.5,300. The complainant accused the respondent of professional misconduct under the Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973.
investigation_summary: The Disciplinary Committee of the N.-W.F.P. Bar Council recorded evidence and forwarded the case to the Tribunal. The respondent denied allegations, claiming he performed duties including drafting a divorce deed and meeting officials. The complainant admitted to concealing facts about his third marriage.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal found no evidence of professional misconduct against the respondent but noted his actions were inconsistent with professional norms. The complaint was dismissed, and the respondent was warned to uphold professional ethics in the future.
punishment: Warning issued to the respondent to maintain professional ethics.
Decision_or_verdict: Complaint dismissed. Parties to bear their own costs.
legal_arguments: Respondent argued he performed professional duties including drafting a divorce deed and visiting Rawalpindi under complainant's instructions.
Complainant alleged professional misconduct and negligence in filing complaints.
statutes: Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973

witness_statement.Liaqat Ali: Admitted to having three wives and strained relations. Alleged professional misconduct by respondent.
witness_statement.Arshad Mehmood Lodhi: Denied allegations, claimed duties were performed including drafting divorce deed and meeting officials.

key_issues: Whether the respondent committed professional misconduct.
Whether the complainant concealed material facts.

maxims.Nemo debet esse judex in propria causa: No one should be a judge in their own cause.

legal_terms.Professional Misconduct: Violation of ethical standards by a legal practitioner.
legal_terms.Code of Conduct: Set of rules governing the behavior of advocates.

Registered acknowledgment due, a postal service.

summary_vector_notes: Complaint dismissed due to lack of evidence of professional misconduct. Respondent warned to uphold professional ethics. Parties bear their own costs.
